TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ArgumentToExpressionConverter extends System.Object implements class System.Windows.Data.IValueConverter

Docs.summary: Defines the mapping between arguments and expressions and provides the functionality to convert between these objects. Typically, this converter is used declaratively when using an in a custom activity designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can also be used imperatively; however, this usage is not recommended.
## Examples The following XAML snippet shows how to use the ArgumentToExpressionConverter in a custom activity designer that uses an ExpressionTextBox.
``` <sapv:ExpressionTextBox Expression="{Binding Path=ModelItem.SampleValue, Mode=TwoWay, Converter={StaticResource ArgumentToExpressionConverter}, ConverterParameter=In }" ExpressionType="s:String" OwnerActivity="{Binding Path=ModelItem}" />
```
